intro: Chorizanthe flava, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy, succulent stems that help it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. It produces small, bead-like seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its propagation across dry landscapes. Chorizanthe flava is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological traits.
